I'll say this one thing, I love Brad, but I have noticed one way in which he can improve in my opinion. I could be alone on this and that's ok, but I would prefer him to just start the playthrough without prefacing or ending his walkthroughs with"If you want more of these videos just click like." Or "If I get 20,000 likes I will continue".
I think one of the main reasons that people listen to Brad is because he's so down to earth, chill, with a comforting  voice, that all has a very calming effect on people.
But every time he mentions the quotes above I'm snapped out of the reality that he is solely doing this for me personally and for his audience. He is like the main character inside the game in my own head that's giving me peace and the character (Brad) literally breaks his own game by reminding me that things are always as they seem. And that's depressing 🤔

Neco is a possible reference to "neko" - Japanese word for cats. The waving cats that you have seen in the ant village are what they call "Maneki neko" or Beckoning Cat in Japanese. They are meant to welcome and greet as well as considered as a lucky charm in any Japanese or Asian establishment. If you ever been to a Japanese restaurant, try to look for one. It usually sits in front of the counter or near the reception. :)

P.S. The gold Maneki nekos we are seeing a lot in the game meant welcoming wealth and prosperity. Surely, a lucky charm for Annapurna Interactive as Stray is breaking records since launch :D

She had been feeling sick like she had the flu or something for some time, Then she went to the med center and they said ok, just go home and if it doesnt get better, come back in a few days. It didnt get better so she went back and they ran some blood-tests but didnt find anything odd so same thing again. After another 2 weeks she went back and they did cell-tests and found out she had cancer in her throat and both her lungs. It had allready spread to far, there was nothing they could do. But she refused to die in a hospital bed like some "vegetable" She wanted to be at home with my dad. The last weeks she needed oxygine-tubes to be able to breathe. She got the diagnose in october, she died in february, so i agree with the saying "fuck cancer" Sorry for rambling, i dont know why this video made me think of this

Caution, nerd shit.
There are several classifications of "Dragon" 
Dragons, Drake's, Wyvern, and Wyrm 
-Dragons that everyone knows have 4 legs and a set of wings.
-Wyvern have 2 (or no) legs and a set of wings. 
-Drakes have 4 legs and no wings
-Wyrms are long Bois with either legs or no legs, and no wings.
Then there are variations on each of those types of dragons which I will not bore everyone with.

The Kuchisake-onna scared the shit out of me when I first encountered it. Small history lesson if people dont know what she is. The Kuchisake-onna, literally the slit mouthed woman, is an urban legend in Japan. She wears a long trench coat, usually red, with a mask and she carries a large pair of scissors. She will then ask you if you think shes pretty. If you say yes, she removes her mask and shows off her carved face and if you still say shes pretty she will carve your face with the scissors to be like her. If you say no, she stabs you to death in rage.

Rule número uno about dragon slaying in Elden Ring. Always do it on Torrent. As you ride towards his face name a swing at their face if you hit cool if not keep it moving and take a couple wacks at the legs (the number depends on the weapon you are using. Usually 2-3) then haul ass because he’s gonna whip around. Rinse and repeat. Do not use a summons it makes their behavior to erratic especially in a small arena like that bridge. This just made me hate Faro even more. Recontextualizing his actions in Zero Dawn as well. He didn’t just delete APOLLO so people wouldn’t judge him after he died, he did it so they would revere him when he CAME BACK. To be worshipped like a god despite killing more people than any human being in history and refusing to actually let them learn mistakes and refusing to take any accountability for the death of mankind. A true egomaniac who literally went insane. It’s almost justice that he got to spend a thousand years as a freakish, cancer-ridden mutant abomination, trapped alone in his bunker, especially after not just the suffering he indirectly inflicted with the Faro Plague and deleting APOLLO, but the suffering he directly caused, murdering the Alphas, murdering those he had in his bunker…

I actually like that they don’t show him in his disgusting, mutant glory. For one, leaving it up to the imagination is arguably even better, just hearing the guttural noises and moans coming from the chamber is enough, but also, we already know everything we need to. Whatever was in there, we know it was disgusting, we know it was sad and pathetic and that he languished for everything he’d done.

I get that opinion on NASCAR but in many ways it is more interesting that F1. You could easily have 10-15 different drivers lead a lap in NASCAR, which is almost unheard of in F1 (usually 1-3).

In fact of the 12 F1 races this year, there have been only 2 have had more than two lap leaders, one for 2 laps and one for 4 laps. There have been 4 races this year where Max Verstappen was the only person to lead a lap (he started and finished in first), and only one other driver has won a race, his teammate in the exact same car, Sergio Perez.

I don’t watch it anymore but NASCAR seems a lot more sensible when you think about the relative differences. Just like F1 the tiniest bit of steering input can shave tenths off or add them to a lap, something that is just as detrimental in NASCAR as F1. When you think of it as ‘just going in circles”, it doesn’t really do justice to the tight groups, high speed, low margin for error, and competitive setting.

NASCAR is also ass in person, I mean complete and total cheeks. It’s loud af, you can’t see anything, and what you can see is on the other side of a 2-3 mile oval so you can barely tell what’s going on.

If you want to watch racing: DTM, Super GT, FIA Endurance, or Rallycross are the only racing that’s good anymore, other than drags. I’d honestly rather watch youth level karting than NASCAR or F1.

Love the content!  Drones you gotta jump on, scan they’re path and find a spot. They’re a bit tough to catch but that all there is to it.

To take out the drones, you climb up high and jump onto them.  They drift down to the ground, then you search them.  After, they go back into the air and fly around.  You take what you got from them the the stand next to Gia and add them to it.  Then you can see the land around them that they see by selecting the one you want.

The drones, you have to scan them to see the path they are moving on then find the spot that is closest to the path and get there to jump on it to drag it down. I did a few of the ruins and found a few of the orbs and didn't know what it was for but this is where you trade them in.

[SUMMARY OF PART 8 | THE EMBASSY -MAIN QUEST]
Part 8 begins as Aloy uses the workbench to upgrade and modify her Outfit and weapons,typically her Bow. Aloy then overrides a Charger and mounted it and rode to Barren Light. At  Barren Light Aloy has to Convince a guard called Lawan to lead her to speak to Commander Nozar  for the Gates to be Opened for her to enter in to the West but Commander Nozar proved stubborn and refused Aloy entrance, Aloy ignored the Commander and asked for the Gates to be Opened and she finally succeeded with the help of Erend. Varl joined Aloy at Barren Light and they passed throught the gates to the West.

There is one more obstacle on Aloy's path and that is the Tenakth tribe,who ordered Aloy not to cross the border between the East and West or she will be killed, but thankfully the Tenakth tribe's Marshal  respected Aloy's and recognized her as the Savior of the Meridian and granted her right of passage into the West.He gave Aloy a special Dagger as a symbol of Right passage to the West. The Part 8 Completed.

It's a game changer really.

I love bows in video games. I've been playing a ton of Splatoon 3, and have always been a huge Zelda fan. Using motion controls for bow combat has been an amazing experience.

Though I heard of Horizon, I didn't really know much about them. I happened upon a video of some high-level gameplay in Forbidden West, and realized that the combat centers around bows. I was instantly hooked.

I've never owned a PlayStation (sad, I know) and been out of the Xbox game for a while now. Always been a Nintendo kid.

But watching your videos on Zero Dawn has felt like a journey, watching this incredible story unfold. I'm hooked. I want to keep going, but also want to save the story for myself to experience someday, but don't think I'll be able to make the time or money for another console for some time.

Either way, thank you for sharing your gameplay of this incredible game. Allows me to experience it without the means to play it myself. That's something at least, and I am grateful!

I remember watching your Dead rising one playthrough before I realized it was even you because the first time I seen it I didn't know who you were because I couldn't read and I didn't really know how playthrough I think all the way through I can't remember but some of your other playthroughs I couldn't keep my interest in it but so far the only two playthroughs that kept my interest was resident evil village and this and some of the things you do kind of annoys me just because like what you do is not what I would do like for example I would give the PK's four things to control so I could get armored or shield guys you could use the impact arrows and send them flying off roofs so yeah but thank you for the playthroughs you do and honestly like I wouldn't mind if you spent a little bit more time like on side missions but if you want to do the main story go right ahead but you'll be missing out on a lot of good equipment that will help you later in the game like again getting the PK crossbow at first you may think it may not seem worth it but the fact that is is it's a projectile weapon and it's better than a bow and arrow simply because it can hold more shoot more and has a You noticed that a lot of games start out in a dark area.  That's an astute observation.  Many games don't, but for the many games that do, the dark is a helpful thing to do because usually the player has no idea where they're headed at the beginning, so beginning in a dark area greatly assists developer tricks like using light to unconsciously guide the player.  Devs use subconscious guidance like this all. the. time. because we humans are drawn toward light.  Think of walking through a dark area and seeing a campfire.  You're naturally going to want to approach it.  You're drawn to light.

Notice at 5:02 you exit the building, then despite being able to see just fine, the path is lined with lights, the doorway you need to pass theough is brightly lit (an attractive destination,) then when you go through the door, the porch up ahead is marked with a lantern and you can see light through the windows.

Starting a game in a dark area, or on a dark and rainy night can also unconsciously symbolize unease and strife in the protagonists current situation.  Maybe their life is in disarray, and the darkness and rain really convey the lack of literal and figurative protection.

Just throwing it out there, but Streets of Rage had no inspiration on Sifu. This game was developed due to a love for martial arts films, and though it has a few game inspirations, it mostly draws from a long list of films on that front.

Here are some of the film inspirations Sloclap had while developing Sifu:

× Kill Bill
× The Raid
× Oldboy
× The Protector
× Kill Zone
× John Wick
× Ip Man
× Lady Snowblood
× Multiple Bruce Lee films
× Multiple Jackie Chan films

Some of these are minor and others are major. An example would be that the story has obvious similarities to Kill Bill. Everything from being left for dead by essentially an assassination squad lead by a leader to hunting down each one individually.

The Squats level is a definite homage to The Raid and the hallway segment of that level is paying homage to Oldboy.

If anyone hasn't seen a lot of these movies and you enjoy Sifu, I recommend you watch them asap. Play through Sifu again after that and you'll notice lots of little things and you'll have a newfound appreciation for the game.

All I can say is that Sloclap deserves a slow clap from all of us. This game is amazing and I hope they do more with this IP; whether that be DLC or even a sequel in a couple years. I can't get enough of it, and it just may be my favorite game of all time.

Appreciate a guide, wish I looked this up when starting out on this disappointing sequel to a legendary game.  Dying Light 1 had its bugs/design flaws, but it had much better character control, Aiden is slow to act and exaggerated in parkour.  Even trying to grab a ledge or hop forward is randomly unsuccessful.  Try stepping up on a long roof vent, it will slide you over it automatically.  Turn off auto-ledge grab and you will still occasionally auto-grab ledges.  100% accurate enemies, infected always target me vs. other humans, howlers 15 feet from a group of raiders and doesn't notice them, enemies can "fall through" your character.  No polearms, staves, etc useful weapons.  Can't make a UV flashlight like first game that lasts more than 3 seconds, or attach a UV flare to your vest for a limited time?  I say if you're going to do something, do it right and get game testers worthy of the title.

Ah man! Good Game! Best Game of 2021 ever played, as well as ever watched! Really enjoyed all the action & story behind each of the characters in Call of Duty: Vanguard! Shame that both Novak & Richard had to be killed off in this game with Novak being the only character you play once as a form of tutorial character during the start of this game. Then again, on the cover & appearance of picture for this game, there are only the 4 playable characters, Arthur, Polina, Wade & Lucas, shown of which you play as in the campaign, so that makes sense.

I like the unique play style for each of the characters you play as throughout the game in their respective backstories. Definitely makes it more enjoyable, challenging, experiencing and most of all fun to play a Call of Duty game in which you play as multiple characters from their own countries! I know this was a thing in the old Call of Duty games, but this new one is much more fun the its predecessors. And the final Level/Story Campaign really shows how incredible of a game in seeing how the remain four Vanguard Soldiers actually cooperate without getting at each others throats just cause they are not from the same country. Equality is what this game showed us as the 4 of them are on the same side & have one common enemy while both surviving & fighting together!

So just a fun fact. At about 12:30 when you were debating what to do about progressing forward. Your team was conducting a maneuver called an Aussie peel. It’s a small unit tactic that’s designed to allow an element to move to a new position while keeping guns pointed at the threat. In a worst case scenario, a wall of lead is sent towards the enemy while they peel off positions one at a time. If done right it looks like peeling a long strip of tape off of a wall

Polina Pertova aka "Lady nightingale", I believe she is based off of the Soviet sniper Lyudmila Mikhailovna Pavlichenko aka "Lady Death", who was a Soviet sniper in the Red Army during World War II, who was credited with 309 confirmed kills, making her the most successful female sniper in recorded history.

That thing at 2:11 is a samovar, Russian tea boiler (a traditional Kashmiri kettle), which my mom has the same design of! It somehow gave me chills, since I feel like anyone from the old Soviet Union or the Eastern Europe knows these things, since the Russian soldiers sold these everywhere.
Just a small fact from the 60's, 70's Eastern Europe for you.

Okay! Best Far Cry Game up to boot since 2021 when it first got released. FINALLY, I'm at the final part of watching your Far Cry 6 Playthrough & I enjoyed it! There were some sad moments, but there were also some good & awesomely incredible moments & events that happened in Far Cry 6. Especially with how you reacted while playing this game & the Easter Eggs this game had to offer. Loved it all the same.

I may not remember all of what was shown in past parts, but I do know that there were some losses on the Good Side with the characters that Dani has encountered throughout her journey this game. Esperanza loses her father, Carlos by bomb explosion, Yelena & the Legends of the '67 Revolution loose both Jonron & El Tigre by Viviro Poisoning, & both Dani & Juan loses Clara at the hands of Anton himself. Talia, Paolo & Bicho are the only ones who didn't loose anybody aside for one of them nearly getting killed of course. But in the end, those 3 survived on their part of their arc. Now that ending was both upsetting yet awesome. Though Anton only killed himself as his way of giving up, but Diego? That's the most sadden moment in seeing him being killed off by his on father. Reason for it or not, that's the most tragic of all in this game.

That Epilogue dialogue after the credits. Juan talking to one of the Smugglers with the Viviro Shipment...and I'm 100% sure that is Vaas from Far Cry 3 that Juan was talking to. Can't believe he made a Voice Cameo in the Post-Credit Ending. But it's also a foreshadow for the first DLC of Far Cry 6 in which you play as the Villains & learning of each of their Arcs that has either sets off or shows what has happened to them after the end of the Far Cry games they appeared in. While I do wish to watch your Far Cry 6 DLC Playthroughs of the 3 Villains of the past Far Cry Games originally, but due to you not uploading the Joseph Seed DLC Playthrough on your Channel after the Pagan DLC I won't be seeing your DLC walkthroughs of them. My apologies. I hope you understand that, Brad. But if you DO come back to this & will do the Joseph Seed DLC, then I will come back to see the Vaas & Pagan DLC Gameplays you have already played before. For now, no watching of those two unless you do Joseph's. Lol.

Incredible & Amazing Far Cry 6 Walkthrough/Gameplay/Playthrough, Brad. I'm still behind, but I do know that I'll eventually catch up to your recent Playthrough that I'm interested in that you're on. But ONLY if it's a game I'm into or that it interest me. Good Game, man. Thank You!

To finish all the main story quests, Capture all road blocks, Capture all FND bases and take out all the air defense canons took me about 45 hours playing aggressively on the harder mode.  To finish all the side stories, the treasure hunts and everything else etc... I am at 65 hours and still going as of today and I think I'm about 90 percent there. 

While the main story was fun. The real fun has been discovering all the places in the side quests. Some of the landscape and environments are amazing like the one where I had to find and explore and HUGE cave system and at the end was the pirate ship like in the goonies hidden inside where you have to fire the ships canon to get out. The haunted Fort full of hidden doors and tricks which you can only access at night or the Crystal skull quest where you have to find and show the crystal skull to the big monkey buda's with glowing eyes to open secret passages underground like maybe Temple of Doom. 

With an extremely detailed and mechanically sound open world map like this they are missing out on other opportunities to create some really cool game DLC's if they don't or easily foundations for whole new games in general.

This is probably me being nitpicky but I am not a fan of this game’s aesthetic… it feels too unrealistic. For god sake Vaas has now been eluded to being alive because he only died in a drugged up fever dream in far cry 3!!! So to me the weapons that were weird or the places that were weird didn’t matter because well there are points were drugs alter our character… but this game doesn’t really have that, it’s about a drug but it’s just having those weird weapons and people and place exist and the game only says deal with it.

There is an auto drive... just press shift when driving a ground car.  You need to be on a road and the destination highlighted.  You can increase or decrease the speed too.  It does not path the best and sometimes hits things, but it will actually try to pass cars and everything.

I have hit as most of the treasure hunts, air drops, and raids.  I have hit so many weapon caches that I only need 3 to have all the guns.  For the unique weapons I have about half.  I also have full sets of over half the clothing and I have over half the charms.  Loving the game.  I only need one of the personal vehicles and I have about 75% of the other vehicles... including 4 tanks, both the jeep and the Hummer with guns and the small and large enemy boat.  I have both their helicopters and one plane.  I tried to get a crop duster but it turns out you can not keep them.
